page.title: 19Conkers and Marbles
page.content: This page describes two playground games that we play at West Haddon School. Conkers is a game played in the autumn and marbles in the summer. A conker is a nut from a horse chestnut tree. Two people play conkers. One person holds his conker out so that it hs down from a string, while the other player hits it with his conker. If he misses they swap roles.The game ends when a conker breaks. A marble is a small glass ball with a wiggly pattern in it. We use a hole about 6cm wide. You roll your marble to get it in the hole. If you miss and the next person gets it in, he has to get in the marble that you rolled. If he gets your marble in the hole as well he wins.
